title: Exodus under a blistering sun in Rayalaseema

Known as Suggi, this age-old custom persists because of the region’s dependence on rain-fed agriculture, acute water shortage and widespread unemployment, finds Hareesh P

title: Goldsmiths in Telangana: Grief beneath the glitter
content: Once the trusted makers of wedding ornaments and cultural heirlooms, generations of artisanal goldsmiths in Telangana are abandoning their ancestral craft and fading into the shadows. Crushed by corporate competition, shifting consumer choices, rising gold prices and the absence of institutional support, many have been driven into debt and despair. P. Laxma Reddy highlights the silent death of local goldsmithing in a golden boom

title: Ballpark evictions, broken bats and Goliath vs. Goliath: The 10 hottest times in New York baseball history
content: baseball was invented in the city nearly 4,500 years ago . he was the Aaron Judge of the Nile . in recent times, baseball has revolved around New York . baseball has been a hot start to the season for the Yankees .

title: 'She's a folk hero in our sport': How NiJaree Canady became college softball's first million-dollar player
content: nijaree canady landed the richest softball NIL deal ever . she had won just 49% of its games and 31% of its league games since the advent of the Big 12 . her new home would be on the arid plains of west Texas at a school .

title: Coast to coast: High school hoops factory relocating from California to Florida
content: Prolific Prep has been a mainstay in the ESPN 25 high school basketball rankings since its inception in 2014 . the team have also produced 14 McDonald's All Americans and been selected to compete in the prestigious Chipotle Nationals tournament for the past six years . this past season, they finished no. 4 in the final ESPN 25 and reached the final Four at the nationals .

title: Potential upsets? Early favorites? We preview the 2025 softball regionals
content: the Oklahoma Sooners begin their quest for a fifth straight ring as the regionals begin on friday . eight of the overall top 10 seeds are from the conference . some of the best pitchers are playing for teams like Texas Tech (NiJaree Canady), Arizona State (Kenzie Brown).

title: Handing out grades for every full-time Cup driver: From four A's to a painful F
content: NASCAR's all-Star race festivities are in North Wilkesboro, North Carolina this weekend . a weighted combination of key performance indicators was used to compare drivers on an even scale . the formula included a variety of components, each standardized in order of importance . it's a chance to take stock of what has happened in the 2025 season so far .

content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in! health Matters Ramya Kannan writes to you on getting to good health, and staying there The Hindu On Books Books of the week .

title: The NBA's balance of power shifted on Monday night
content: defending champions Boston Celtics lose Jayson Tatum for the rest of the season . when leBron James chose the Miami Heat on July 8, 2010, when Kevin Durant joined the Golden State Warriors on July 7, 2016. When Kobe Bryant dropped 60 points in the final game of his career on April 13, 2016 .

title: 'West trying to pit India against China': Russia foreign minister
content: Sergei Lavrov, the Russian foreign minister, has accused the West of attempting to create discord between India and China by promoting an anti-China agenda in the Indo-Pacific region. He warned that Western powers are also trying to diminish ASEAN's role in regional affairs by undermining consensus and encouraging divisive groupings.

title: Pak's ex-air marshal admits AWACS damaged in Op Sindoor
content: Retired Pakistani Air Marshal Masood Akhtar admitted on camera that Indian precision strikes under Operation Sindoor damaged a Pakistani AWACS aircraft at Bholari airbase. The strikes, a retaliation for the Pahalgam terror attack, targeted key military installations, contradicting Pakistan's attempts to downplay the extent of the damage. Indian Air Marshal AK Bharti confirmed that 11 Pakistani air bases were hit.

title: As Pakistan reels from Op Sindoor, Baloch makes move to break away
content: Razzak Baloch asserts Pakistan's diminished control in Balochistan, urging international support for the Baloch struggle, particularly from India and the United States. Mir Yar Baloch has declared independence from Pakistan, highlighting historical grievances and alleged exploitation. The Baloch independence movement traces back to 1947, fueled by claims of forced annexation and human rights abuses.

title: How Trump's boast on India-Pak ceasefire could cost US billions
content: Michael Rubin criticizes Donald Trump's claim of brokering a ceasefire between India and Pakistan, arguing it jeopardizes strategic trust and billions in potential defense deals. Trump's boast of leveraging trade to halt hostilities risks undermining the deepening alignment between the US and India, potentially pushing New Delhi away from American arms deals.

title: Watch: Rohit Sharma Stand inaugurated at Wankhede as MCA pays tribute to legends
content: The Wankhede Stadium honoured cricketing legends by inaugurating commemorative sections, highlighted by the naming of a stand after Rohit Sharma, recognising his immense contributions to Indian cricket and Mumbai Indians. Additionally, stands were dedicated to Ajit Wadekar and Sharad Pawar, acknowledging their significant impact on Indian cricket history.

title: Elon Musk responds to ex-FBI director’s ‘8647’ post 'calling for Trump's murder'
content: James Comey's cryptic Instagram post featuring seashells arranged as "8647" has ignited a firestorm of controversy. Many interpret the post as a veiled threat against Donald Trump, referencing slang for 'remove' and his position as the 47th president. The post has drawn criticism from Trump's allies, including Donald Trump Jr.

title: 'Pak will spend on terror infra': Rajnath asks IMF to reconsider $1bn loan
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Friday urged the IMF to reconsider its loan to Pakistan, fearing funds will be used for terror infrastructure. India abstained from the vote, citing Pakistan's history of misusing funds and supporting cross-border terrorism. India also highlighted the military's significant control over Pakistan's economy, hindering structural reforms.

title: 'We already have one': Patidar on chances of being first RCB captain to win a trophy
content: The RCB skipper feels that expectations and pressure on him are high. The 31-year-old will have a solid shot at leading his side to glory this season and only needs one win to confirm a spot in the playoffs. He however stressed that RCB already has one title to its name.

title: Govt slams Amazon, Flipkart for selling Pakistani flags, cites national sentiment violation
content: The CCPA has issued notices to e-commerce platforms like Amazon and Flipkart for selling Pakistani national flags and merchandise, deemed insensitive and a violation of national sentiment. Union Minister Pralhad Joshi directed the platforms to immediately remove such listings and adhere to national laws.

title: 'Grilled every night': BSF jawan recalls 21-day ordeal in Pak
content: BSF jawan Purnam Kumar Shaw, recently freed after 21 days in Pakistan, endured nightly interrogations about BSF deployments, his wife Rajani revealed. Shaw, who inadvertently crossed the border in Punjab, reported being mentally drained despite no physical torture. Treated like a spy and moved to multiple locations, including near an airbase, he was sleep-deprived.

title: 'A boy from Borivali ...': Ambani congratulates Rohit on Wankhede stand honour
content: Akash Ambani lauded Rohit Sharma as the Mumbai Cricket Association unveiled a stand named in his honour at Wankhede Stadium. Ambani highlighted Sharma's journey from Borivali to becoming a global cricket icon, inspiring a new generation. Sharma's contributions to Mumbai Indians and the Indian national team were celebrated, marking his legacy at the iconic venue.

title: Paresh Rawal quits 'Hera Pheri 3' co-starring Akshay Kumar, Suniel Shetty
content: Paresh Rawal, known for his iconic role as Baburao in 'Hera Pheri', has officially exited 'Hera Pheri 3' due to creative disagreements with the producers. This news follows a series of setbacks for the film, including Akshay Kumar's initial departure and subsequent return.

title: Why it won’t be easy for Apple to solve Donald Trump's 'little problem'
content: Donald Trump wants Apple to manufacture iPhones in the US, not India, creating a challenge for Tim Cook. Despite past efforts and potential automation, shifting production faces hurdles like skill gaps, supply chain complexities, and cost concerns. Apple's reliance on Asia's established ecosystem and India's growing manufacturing capabilities present a dilemma, impacting profit margins and strategic decisions.

title: 'I'll rise above the gutter ... ': Omar, Mehbooba spar over Indus Water Treaty
content: Mehbooba Mufti has criticized Omar Abdullah's call to revive the Tulbul Navigation Project amidst India-Pakistan tensions. She deemed his statements irresponsible, emphasizing that J&K needs peace, not actions risking further conflict. Abdullah suggested resuming the project, suspended due to Pakistani objections under the Indus Water Treaty, now that the treaty is in abeyance.

title: How Army acted on specific intel to neutralise 6 terrorists in J&K
content: Security forces in Jammu and Kashmir have successfully neutralised six terrorists in two separate anti-terror operations in Kelar and Tral areas over the past 48 hours. The joint operations by the Indian Army, Jammu and Kashmir Police, and CRPF signify an intensified focus on eliminating the terror ecosystem in the Kashmir Valley.

title: Scientists reveal new working pattern that can cause brain damage: All you must know
content: A recent study reveals that consistently working over 52 hours a week can significantly alter brain structure, impacting executive function, emotional regulation, and decision-making abilities. Researchers from Yonsei University emphasize the importance of addressing overwork as a serious occupational health concern, citing its links to cardiovascular disease, mental health issues, and a high annual death toll. Read more below!

title: Rajasthan man halts mother’s cremation, creates ruckus over jewellery
content: A cremation in Rajasthan's Kotputli-Behror was delayed for two hours due to a dispute over the deceased woman's jewelry. Omprakash, one of the woman's seven sons, halted the funeral, demanding his mother's silver bangles. He lay on the pyre, refusing to move until his demands were met.

title: Brad Marchand smirked at fired-up Leafs' fan as he came face to face with the fan
content: Brad Marchand, now with the Florida Panthers, faced Toronto Maple Leafs fans. A video shows a fan confronting Marchand. Marchand simply smirked at the fan. This interaction sparked funny reactions online. Fans commented on Marchand's reaction and the Leafs' performance. The Panthers and Marchand have not commented on the incident. The video is now viral.

title: Inside story: How, and why, Mayank Yadav broke down. Again!
content: Mayank Yadav's comeback to Lucknow Super Giants was cut short due to injury concerns, raising questions about his rehabilitation. Despite initial excitement, his pace dropped significantly, baffling the team. Sources suggest he was rushed back after limited bowling sessions at the BCCI's Centre of Excellence.

title: UP horror: Wife, her 3 lovers chop man into 6 pieces; head dumped in river
content: In a shocking incident in Ballia, Devendra Ram, a retired electrician, was brutally murdered by his wife and her three lovers. Maya, the wife, and one lover, Mithilesh Patel, were arrested after the discovery of dismembered body parts. Further investigation led to the arrest of Anil and Satish Yadav following a police encounter. They confessed to the murder, revealing the crime was premeditated. Devendra's body was chopped into six pieces, with the head still missing.

title: SC directs Bengal govt to pay 25% DA to its employees; BJP hails directive
content: The Supreme Court has instructed the West Bengal government to disburse 25% Dearness Allowance (DA) to its employees within three months, marking an interim decision in the ongoing dispute over DA parity with central government employees. This directive follows a 2022 Calcutta High Court ruling that aimed to align state DA payments with the central rate.

title: Vijay Shah no stranger to controversies: When Vidya Balan declined dinner invite
content: Vijay Shah, a Madhya Pradesh minister, is in trouble again. The High Court has ordered police to file a case against him. Shah allegedly called Colonel Sofiya Qureshi the "sister of terrorists" at an event in Indore. This isn't Shah's first controversy. He faced criticism in 2020 and resigned in 2013. Shah has apologized and said he respects Colonel Qureshi.

title: Pakistan deputy PM Ishaq Dar cites fake news to laud PAF, gets fact-checked at home
content: Pakistan's Deputy Prime Minister Ishaq Dar faced embarrassment after falsely claiming in the Senate that The Daily Telegraph lauded the Pakistan Air Force as the "undisputed king of the skies." The Dawn, a Pakistani newspaper, debunked Dar's statement, revealing the claim originated from a fake social media image. This incident occurred amidst heightened tensions between India and Pakistan.

title: 'You don't leave the team ... ': Shastri's fiery take on Rohit Sharma
content: Rohit Sharma's decision to skip the Sydney Test earlier this year, despite Ravi Shastri's strong disagreement, has resurfaced. Shastri revealed he would have insisted Sharma play, believing his potential match-winning innings, even a small one, could have altered the series outcome. Earlier in June 2024, Rohit had also called time on his T20I career after leading India to a seven-run victory over South Africa in the final of the 2024 Men's T20 World Cup.

title: Gold best performing asset of FY25 but equities outperform in long-term
content: Gold surged in FY25, gaining 41% in USD and 33% in rupee terms, driven by its safe-haven status and central bank buying. Despite this, Indian equities outperformed gold over longer periods.

title: Former CJI D Y Chandrachud appointed as 'distinguished professor' at NLU Delhi
content: Former Chief Justice of India, D Y Chandrachud, has been appointed as a 'distinguished professor' at National Law University (NLU), Delhi, marking a significant advancement for legal education. NLU Delhi will establish a Centre for Constitutional Studies under his leadership. Starting July 2025, a lecture series will explore Justice Chandrachud's landmark judgments on privacy, LGBTQ+ rights, and judicial reforms.

title: The humans of IPL: Unsung heroes who ensure calm amid the chaos
content: With the 18th edition of the Indian Premier League (IPL) set to resume on Saturday, TimesofIndia.com delves deep into the lives of the individuals who manage everything from booking flights, hotels, and cabs to ensuring the safety and comfort of players and their travelling families, especially in extraordinary situations like the one that unfolded on May 8 in Dharamsala.

title: BJP compares Pakistan's loss to India to Operation Sindoor
content: The Bhartiya Janata Party's official X account posted a video comparing India's victory in a 2007 T20 World Cup bowl-off against Pakistan to Operation Sindoor, India's response to the Pahalgam terrorist attack. The post sarcastically mocked Pakistan's failure in the bowl-off, drawing parallels to the military operation targeting terrorist elements in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir.

title: Celebi shares crash 10% after India revokes security clearance
content: Celebi Hava Servisi's shares plummeted 10% after India revoked security clearance for its Indian unit, Celebi Airport Services India, citing national security concerns. The decision, impacting operations at nine major airports, follows increasing pressure on the Turkish ground service provider.

title: Outrage over remarks on Col Qureshi: MP minister may find it hard to escape this time
content: Madhya Pradesh minister Vijay Shah faces mounting pressure to resign after his remarks about Colonel Sofiya Qureshi were deemed offensive by the High Court and Supreme Court. Despite the BJP leadership's annoyance and public outcry, the party hesitates to sack him due to his standing as a prominent tribal leader.

title: Cong's P Chidambaram admits INDIA bloc 'frayed'; BJP calls it 'tukde-tukde alliance'
content: Senior Congress leader P Chidambaram expressed uncertainty about the INDIA bloc's future, acknowledging its current 'frayed' state while emphasizing the possibility of revival. He highlighted the BJP's formidable organizational strength and its influence over institutions.

title: India defence stocks surge after ceasefire; China’s drop
content: Following the India-Pakistan ceasefire and Operation Sindoor, Indian defence stocks surged, reflecting confidence in indigenous military capabilities. Conversely, Chinese defence stocks, particularly those associated with weapons used by Pakistan, plummeted.

title: River returns: Bundelkhand villagers revive 80km lifeline in parched land
content: In a remarkable feat of community effort, the Noon river in Bundelkhand's Jalaun district is being revived after years of desiccation. Local residents restored 14 km of the drainage basin, creating a funnel for water to flow back into the 81-km river. Prime Minister Modi lauded the initiative as 'sabka prayas,' highlighting the collective will of villagers

title: Ravi Shastri drops bombshell on Virat Kohli's retirement
content: Ravi Shastri expressed surprise at Virat Kohli's Test retirement, believing he had more years left. Shastri noted Kohli's intense dedication and the mental toll it took, potentially leading to burnout. He acknowledged Kohli's global impact and achievements, emphasizing that Kohli has nothing left to prove in cricket after achieving so much.

title: ATS probes ‘mysterious’ QR codes at shrines, suspects fund diversion to extremist networks
content: Maharashtra ATS is investigating suspicious QR codes found at religious shrines, including those in Nagpur, to uncover unauthorized funding channels. An offence was registered against Mohd Ejaz Ansari for diverting funds, meant for a women's religious institution, into his personal account using a QR code at a Qamar Colony shrine.

title: IPL 2025: Which overseas players are returning and who are not
content: Mitchell Starc's decision to withdraw from the remainder of the IPL is a major setback for Delhi Capitals' playoff aspirations. The league, which resumes on May 17 after a suspension, sees a flurry of overseas player replacements. The IPL was suspended on May 8 following heightened military tensions between India and Pakistan. The league resumes after ceasefire agreement between the two countries.

title: US becomes India’s 4th largest crude oil supplier; Russia still tops chart
content: In April, the US nearly doubled its crude oil supply to India, surpassing the UAE to become India's fourth-largest supplier. Imports from the US reached 0.33 million barrels per day, giving the US a 7.3% share of India's crude imports.

title: Bouncers at school gate: Parents accuse DPS Dwarka of inhumane practices
content: More than 100 parents have approached the Delhi High Court. They allege Delhi Public School Dwarka expelled students. The reason is a fee dispute. Parents also claim the school used bouncers. They say it was to manage children. Parents want the government to take over the school. The Directorate of Education has instructed the school to reinstate students.

title: FIFA delays verdict on Israeli settlement clubs as political tensions rise
content: FIFA's decision to postpone the ruling on Israeli settlement clubs has intensified tensions, prompting strong criticism from Palestinian officials during the FIFA Congress. Susan Shalabi urged immediate action, highlighting the long-standing issue of settlement clubs undermining Palestinian control and violating FIFA rules.

title: Jharkhand horror: Woman beheaded with sword over neighbourhood drain dispute
content: In Dumka, a tragic incident unfolded as Vimla Devi, 50, was beheaded, and her husband injured, by Fulchand Sah, 25, following a dispute over drain water. The altercation escalated when Sah attacked the couple with a sword. Police have arrested the accused, the son of a policeman, and seized the weapon, while the victim's husband receives treatment for his injuries.

title: Close call: Truck rolls back, woman survives horrific crash by inches
content: In a harrowing incident near Kozhikode Medical College, a truck laden with bricks lost control on an incline and rolled backward, striking a scooter. Ashwathi, the scooter rider, was thrown onto the road but narrowly escaped serious injury as the truck halted just inches away from her.

title: New Zealand suspends three Maori MPs for 'intimidating' haka protest in Parliament
content: Three Maori MPs face suspension from New Zealand's Parliament over performing a haka to protest the Treaty Principles Bill. The parliamentary privileges committee recommended suspensions for Rawiri Waititi, Debbie Ngarewa-Packer, and Hana-Rawhiti Maipi-Clarke, deeming their actions disruptive and potentially intimidating. This decision has sparked outrage from Te Pati Maori, who view it as a disproportionate punishment for resisting colonial power.

title: In UP village, jubilations mark local lad's coronation as mayor of British town
content: Raj Mishra, originally from a remote village in Mirzapur, Uttar Pradesh, has been elected as the mayor of Wellingborough in North Northamptonshire, England. This victory is particularly significant as he represents a small Indian population in the town.

title: The Boston Celtics and the price of history
content: the extended Boston Celtics franchise gathered in a theater to celebrate another championship . a few blocks from the Brahmin church where Bob Cousy eulogized John Havlicek, and from the four-star hotel where Red Auerbach lived . the party was a high table meeting of those witnesses and high priests .

title: NBA playoff takeaways: Nuggets force Game 7 vs. top-seeded Thunder
content: no. 4 seed Indiana Pacers beat the no. 1 seed Cleveland Cavaliers 2-0 in the Eastern and Western Conference semifinals . the team will now travel to Madison Square Garden for a huge Game 6 on friday . no. 2 seed Boston Celtics held off the No. 3 seed New York Knicks in Game 5 on Wednesday .

title: Hong Kong, Singapore report sharp jump in Covid cases as virus detected in sewage water
content: At TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. With an unwavering commitment to accuracy, depth, and timeliness, we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers. Join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world. content: the TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: Blog: Blog | For Right-Wing, A Owaisi Is Indeed Team 'B'
content: asaduddin Owaisi has been "honoured" with the team 'B' tag . the label was thrown at him by the BJP and its allies because they believed that his fielding candidates in states like Maharashtra was aimed at splitting the minority votes . in the last two weeks, the ruling party and its supporters are celebrating him for putting Pakistan in its place .
